metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14314 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A memory out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the Linux kernel before5.9-rc2 with the ext3/ext4 file system, in the way it accesses a directorywith broken indexing. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system ifthe directory exists. The highest threat from this vulnerability is tosystem availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-121-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-121-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-121-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-121-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-121-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1077-kvm - 4.15.0-1077.79

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-121.123').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
